Title: Contract Finder Award Notice
Description:
Award of contract via Further Competition for discovery work for the introduction of Dose Syntax into Primary Care Prescribing Systems is the key enabler for full interoperability of medicine information, allowing machine readable medicine information to be transferred across the NHS for consumption in other systems.   

Development of this capability is complex and impacts many areas of the GP systems, including, but not limited to, the database architecture, existing workflows and user interface. Of these elements, the success of the introduction of the Dose Syntax is heavily dependent upon the Business Change experienced by the GP staff when using the new workflows, and the User Experience of using the new system capability in their day to day work. 
To ensure the impacts of adopting these standards and introducing new workflows to GP practices are thoroughly investigated, the start of this work is a comprehensive discovery phase.

Bolsover District Council wishes to appoint a principal contractor on the basis of a JCT contract for their Kitchen Upgrade Programme within tenanted council owned homes.
      The work comprises both structural and non-structural upgrades including new units, worktops, plumbing, electrical and tiling, within occupied properties.
      Contractors may also be required to undertake responsive kitchen upgrade works within vacant 'void' properties upon request, working to a 4-week timeframe in completing all required works.
      Proposed start on site is April 2022 and will comprise (1+2+2 years) duration.
      The majority of work will take place in occupied properties so the tenant needs and requirements are paramount. The successful contractor will be expected to show flexibility, excellence in tenant support / liaison and work in partnership with the Contract Administrator / Building Surveyor to meet and exceed tenant expectation and levels of satisfaction.

Title: Safe and Warm Upgrade Scheme at Valley View Hillstown - AWARD
Description:
Bolsover District Council have recognised a need for investment in their housing stock and in particular those buildings which provide accommodation to elderly and vulnerable tenants.
      This project will see the modernisation and upgrade of all flats and communal areas within sheltered accommodation at Valley View Hillstown and the construction of a new communal room extension to add to the existing facilities. The optional construction of bungalows within the grounds are included within the scheme as per specification.
      The existing building is currently dependent upon an ageing and dilapidated heating service, offers out-dated living accommodation and has non-standardised kitchen, shower / bathroom facilities.
      The Tenderer shall be the Principal Contractor and Main Contractor for this project which shall encompass the heating upgrade programme, modernisation and layout changes to bedsits and flats as specified, kitchen upgrade programme, full bathroom to wetroom conversion programme, installation of smoke / heat detection alarms and improvements to fire stopping and the installation of sprinkler systems within all areas of the building.

Title: HARMONY:  Primary Travel Demand Data Collection
Description:
This request for quotations (RFQ) is for the provision of a suitable supplier to recruit individuals to participate in a travel demand survey that will take place in Oxfordshire County. The survey will be conducted via a smartphone-based travel survey tool that has already been designed. The organization that will be awarded the contract will be responsible only for recruiting the required sample and monitor the data collection process. The maximum available budget for this contract is Â£75,000 (including VAT). 

This survey takes place within the European Commission H2020 funded project HARMONY (https://harmony-h2020.eu). The purpose of this survey is to collect travel demand and preference data within the Oxfordshire County.

Title: PQ0356 - Foster Birmingham Website  - AWARD
Description:
Foster Birmingham is working towards achieving our Statement of Purpose vision of providing fostered children "...with safe and secure environments in which they can thrive, fulfilling their aspirations" through the provision of an independently hosted website that sets the Foster Birmingham brand apart from its competitors.
      
      Recruitment and retention of fostering households goes a long way to achieving a financially successful service, allowing more money to be reinvested in support for the families and children in our service instead of paying the high costs of placing a child with an independent fostering agency.  
      We are interested in seeing options for a refresh of the current Foster Birmingham logo but are constricted by budget from completing a full rebranding exercise, therefore consideration would be taken when scoring applications that do not address this desirable requirement. 
      
      This contract will be for a period of 2 years commencing from the date of signing with an option to extend for a further 12 months.  
      
      The Council will be using its free to use e-tendering system (in-tend) for the administration of this procurement process and potential suppliers must register with the system to be able to express an interest. If you wish to express an interest in this opportunity please click on the following link to access https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register. You will then be sent details on how to log on which will enable you to download all relevant quotation documentation.  
      
      If you are unable to register with In-tend or have any questions or problems on how to use this web site please either email us at: cps@birmingham.gov.uk 
      
      Your completed quotation submission should be returned by noon on 9th March 2022 via the 'in-tend' system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc

Title: Provision of Lloyd George Record Digitisation Services - Lot 1 - Scanning Services NHS Norfolk & Waveney CCG/NHS Norfolk & Waveney Integrated Care Board
Description:
The LG patient record comprises of the LG envelope and the contents, which is an important part of the patient's historical medical record. Each Lloyd George envelope has a broad range of detailed personal information stored inside and maintaining the security accuracy, availability and integrity of these legacy records is vital. The handling of these records needs particular care; the paper records can be up to 70 years old and some records are fragile and in a poor state, coupled with the fact the information they hold is vital and paramount for safe medical practice. The lack of continuity and resilience within the paper record poses a risk to the ongoing, continuity of person-centred care.. There is a legal requirement to keep the full patients record for a minimum of 10 years after the death of a patient.

There are four primary reasons for digitisation of Lloyd George records:
â¢	safer care for patients 
â¢	release of space within practices to provide additional consultation areas
â¢	access to the full patient record at the point of care
â¢	GP Contract commitments to digitise all Lloyd George patient records by March 2022.



This procurement followed a competitive tender using the NHS England and NHS Improvement Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) (OJEU Reference 2020/S 152-373617) which was established by the NHS England and NHS Improvement National Commercial and Procurement Hub as a route to awarding contracts for Lloyd George Record Digitisation Services. It is compliant with the public procurement regulations and public authority standing financial instructions. To note, the tender is caught in the scope of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 - Regulation 34: Dynamic Purchasing Systems.

NHS Norfolk & Waveney CCG/NHS Norfolk & Waveney Integrated Care Board have awarded a contract to deliver their Lloyd George Record Digitisation Services

This procurement process was facilitated by the NHS England National and Commercial Procurement Hub (commissioned from the SCW CSU) on behalf of the Commissioners.

Title: Enhanced Passive Sonobuoy and MSA Receiver - SBM5
Description:
The aim of this task is to de-risk the designs of an Enhanced Passive Sonobuoy 
(EPS) and a new Multi-Static Active (MSA) Receiver Sonobuoy (MSARS) optimised 
for use with the G-ALFEA sonobuoy. The main output of this task will be preliminary 
designs for the EPS and MSARS that would allow prototypes of the two sonobuoy 
types to be built with minimal technical risk in potential follow-on work.
Background
The Miniaturised Sonobuoy Phase 4 (SBM4) task resulted in a range of options being 
presented designed to meet the requirements for a G-size size sonobuoy capable of 
passive sensing and acting as a receiver in a Multi-Static Active (MSA) field. These 
options included sonobuoys that would meet both passive sensing and MSA receiver 
requirements in a single package and sonobuoy types that are specialised for either 
passive sensing or for use as a MSA receiver. A stakeholder workshop was held in which 
it was concluded that the best options to be taken forward are:
1. a specialised passive sensing sonobuoy that enhances the existing HIDAR 
sonobuoy with an additional wideband transducer, and
2. a specialised MSA receiver sonobuoy based on the BARRA sonobuoy but 
packaged as a G-size sonobuoy (G-BARRA sonobuoy)

Description:
East Sussex Fire Authority (ESFA) is seeking to award a contract for the design and partial refurbishment of Hove Fire Station, in accordance with the latest JCT Design and Build 2016 Edition contract and associated design documents as appended to this tender.

The tender will be conducted as a mini-competition open to all approved suppliers available through Lot 14 of the Brighton and Hove City Council and East Sussex County Council Planned Maintenance Framework Agreement. 

East Sussex Fire Authority is responsible for the provision of the Fire and Rescue Service in East Sussex and the City of Brighton & Hove. East Sussex Fire and Rescue Service is an emergency public service, which requires to be fully operational 24 hours each day on every day of the year.

The Authority serves the population within the City of Brighton & Hove and the county of East Sussex (~ 830,000 people) and has a network of both operational and support staff operating out of the Authority HQ, Community Fire Stations and our Training Centre.
East Sussex Fire and Rescue Service co-locates with Sussex Police at a shared HQ in Lewes. However, it maintains 24 Community Fire Stations and the Service Training Centre at Maresfield.
This contract will cover the refurbishment of Hove Fire Station, as outlined in the design documents. 
The successful Contractor will have to demonstrate that they have the capability and capacity to deliver this works, in a live operational fire station.
The successful Contractor will have to demonstrate flexibility in its approach to providing the Services and must be committed to achieving and improving performance, customer care and satisfaction.
East Sussex Fire & Rescue Service supports and would look to its suppliers to follow Social Value issues.  
The successful Contractor must be able to commence service delivery within 10 working days of signed contracts being exchanged.

Title: Provision of a Travel & Trace Solution
Description: As part of the Covid-19 response, establishing the location of internationally travelling staff and students was key to identifying at risk individuals in order to provide support to return to the UK/to home countries, or to provide remote support where this was not possible.   This has driven the requirement for a more robust travel process to enable a quick and coordinated response to any future incident.  Our vision is to have a high profile travel and trace solution, working across Professionalâ¯Servicesâ¯to offer security, safety and emergency management as a single point of information for all travellers.    The centralised solution will ensure all UK and international travel is registered by policy, with responsibility and accountability defined, and booking unable to progress without confirmation of (a) authorisation to travel, (b) health and safety risk assessment completed and approved, and (c) confirmation that insurance will be in place.

Organisation Name: Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy
Title: SBRI - Biomass Feedstocks Innovation Programme: Phase 2 (Notice 1 of 2)
Description:
Award Notice 1 of 2 for SBRI - Biomass Feedstocks Innovation Programme: Phase 2

Onâ¯20 December 2021â¯the Authority issued an invitation to tenderâ¯to the participants of Phase 1 of the Biomass Feedstocks Innovation Programme, for the demonstration phase of the programme (Phase 2). The programme supports projects that seek to increase the production of sustainable UK biomass by funding innovative project development ideas that address barriers to biomass feedstocks production This project demonstration phase will enable suppliers to demonstrate innovations that will deliver commercially viable innovations in biomass production. 

Phase 2 runs for just under 3 years and is supporting a variety of feedstock types, from miscanthus to short rotation coppice willow to macroalgae. It also supports a variety of technology innovations that seek to improve productivity, through breeding, planting, cultivating and harvesting. 

9 SBRI Contracts signed to date of a combined value of Â£25,913,409.41

Title: Swindon Road, Wroughton - Footway reconditioning
Description:
Swindon Borough Council invites expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced service providers for the provision of reconditioning the footway on Swindon Road, Wroughton between Berkeley Farm development and the entrance to Wood Farm. This extent has been split into a 4-phase programme. Tenderers are to provide costings for each phase individually as available funding may limit how much can be carried out overall. The four phases are:
â¢	Phase 1 - Berkeley Farm Dairy entrance
â¢	Phase 2 - Berkeley Farm to Old Dairy
â¢	Phase 3 - Old Dairy to lamp column 53
â¢	Phase 4 - Lamp column 53 to Wood Farm entrance

Project Description

The project will include the following elements:

â¢	Siding out prior to footway works
â¢	Installation of new path edgings if none are present (verge encroachment on to footway hides whether there are existing path edgings present)
â¢	Replacement of existing kerbing
â¢	Resetting levels of existing apparatus where necessary
â¢	Resurfacing the footway (60mm binder & 30mm surface unless otherwise stated - binder layer thicknesses have been increased at accesses to neighbouring properties)
â¢	Provision of appropriate traffic management (TM) to undertake the works safely
â¢	Provide TM plans and working methodology to SBC prior to works commencing

Title: Support towards Independent Living for 16 and 17 year old care leavers and homeless young people
Description:
To provide Long Term accommodation places, the core elements of this are:   
â¢ to provide pre tenancy work with the Care Leavers 
â¢ a 2 week taster flat experience for all those young people.  
â¢ identify and secure suitable accommodation within the Bradford District.  
â¢ support Care Leavers to furnish their tenancy through a combination of     
   o a small furnishing grant

Title: Primary Care Prescribing Decision Support System - Hertfordshire and West Essex
Description:
The Prescribing Decision Support Tool enables prescribers (GPs, nurses and pharmacists) to understand the recommended local choices for prescribing.  The implementation of this system creates significant savings through prescribers accepting the recommended switches and also educates prescribers to select those first choice products the next time these are prescribed.  The tool also provides safety messages at the point of prescribing.

A contract to deliver the Prescribing Decision Support Tool across the Hertfordshire and West Essex Integrated Care Board (HWE ICB) area has been awarded to Optum.  This contract has been awarded via the SBS Framework for Medicines Management Prescribing Decision Support Systems 2 (Reference SBS/19/AB/WAS/9389) following a review of all available tools within the Framework to fully explore the service offering to enable an informed decision to be made on which tool best meets the needs of the Contracting Authority and provides the best value for money solution, in line with the requirements of the Framework Agreement.

The contract will be a single contract covering all 3 CCGs in Hertfordshire and West Essex (Herts Valleys CCG, East and North Herts CCG and West Essex CCG) and hosted by West Essex CCG until 1st July 2022 at which time the contract will transfer to the Hertfordshire and West Essex Integrated Care Board.
Contact Address 1: Building 4 Spencer Close, St Margaret's Hospital, The Plain

Title: FM21272 The Use of Metal and Non-metal Nanomaterials in Consumer Products and Associated Safety Issues
Description:
The final date and time for the submission of bids is Tuesday 11th January 2022 at 11:00.

DO NOT apply directly to the buyer.

All tender information MUST be submitted through the Delta eSourcing Portal.

This project is being recruited as part of the BEIS Office for Product Safety and Standards Strategic Research Programme (SRP), which was launched in March 2018. This programme provides high quality strategic science-based research to strengthen the evidence base for Safety and Standards policy development, delivery and enforcement, giving business the confidence to innovate and protecting consumers from unsafe products. The wide range of evidence-based research supported by the SRP helps to address critical questions relating to current product safety, and/or issues that might arise due to future market developments.

This project will review literature on the use and prevalence of metal and non-metal nanomaterials in consumer products regulated by OPSS and the associated safety issues. Specifically, this project will provide OPSS with an enhanced nanomaterials evidence base, inclusive of the full landscape of manufacturers' responsibilities and relied upon industrial standards, to inform the prioritisation of future nanomaterials-focused testing and research projects. 

Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the Document Uploads tab within the Delta eSourcing Portal. 

This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria as set out in the  ITQ  document

How to Apply

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Delta eSourcing Portal for this procurement. 

To register on the Delta eSourcing portal please use the link https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and follow the instructions to register.

If you are already registered on the Delta eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and the follow the instructions to 'Log in' 

Once you are logged into the system you will be able to link yourself into this procurement using the Access Code: S974PPN843
Attachments: FM21272 - Tender Documentation.zip
Additional Text:
DO NOT APPLY DIRECTLY TO BUYER

All submissions will be assessed in accordance with the Public Procurement Regulations that apply to this opportunity.

Responses must be received by the date and time in the tender documentation; responses received outside of the deadline or not sent via the Delta eSourcing portal will not be accepted or considered by the Contracting Authority further for this opportunity. Interested organisations should ensure that they allow a sufficiency of time, prior to the deadline to allow all sections to be completed in full and any attachments to be uploaded.

As a user of the Delta eSourcing Portal you will have access to the Delta messaging service which facilitates all messages sent to you and from you, as well as other messages and updates in relation to any specific tender event. Please note that any and all information secured outside of the messaging service, shall have no merit or worth and should not be relied upon by any organisation submitting a tender response. 

Please note it is your organisations responsibility to access these messages on a regular basis to ensure you have sight of all relevant information applicable to this opportunity.

The Contracting Authority expressly reserves the right:

Title: Clinical Decision Support Solution (Clinical Templates) - Hertfordshire and West Essex
Description:
The Clinical Commissioning Groups within Hertfordshire and West Essex have conducted a procurement process using the Crown Commercial Services G Cloud 12 Framework to award a contract to provide a Clinical Decision Support Solution (Clinical Templates). The purpose of these tools is to support practices in identifying patients requiring care, entering information in a structured and standard way across the HWE area and reporting information into the Clinical Commissioning Groups as well as understanding health needs within the population.

These tools will also support the clinical delivery as well as monitoring and payment of enhanced commissioning services in primary care. The service will provide a consistent offer across the Hertfordshire and West Essex area.

The contract is for a period of 2-years with the option to extend for a further 12 months. The value included within this notice is inclusive of the option. The value for the initial 2-year period is Â£1,378,150 (excluding VAT).  

The contract is hosted by East and North Hertfordshire Clinical Commissioning Group on behalf of the Clinical Commissioning Groups within the Hertfordshire and West Essex Integrated Care Board.  Herts Valleys Clinical Commissioning Group and West Essex Clinical Commissioning Group are associates to the contract.

Title: eITT Tree Inspection Services - Fareham Borough Council
Description:
Rapid population growth and increased urbanisation through modern residential development has squeezed people and trees closer together, increasing safety and land-use conflicts. Despite the multiple benefits trees provide they can also damage human prospects through causing serious harm, i.e. death and injury; nuisance through structural damage or physical interference - disruption to surfaces; inconvenience by impeding normal use of land, excessive shade, encroachment; and increased management costs due to unexpected maintenance. \r
\r
This proximity has forced an increasing intensity of proactive tree management by maintaining trees to reduce their harmful impact on people and to optimise the benefits they provide our communities

Organisation Name: Essex Police, Fire and Crime Commissioner Fire and Rescue Authority
Title: GB-Rivenhall: Provision of Physiotherapy Services
Description: Contract award notice for the provision of physiotherapy services to employees of Essex County Fire and Rescue Service, both operational and support staff. All treatment is to be planned, administered and conducted by a qualified physiotherapist, registered with the Health & Care Professions Council and who is a member of the Chartered Society of Physiotherapists. To reflect the geographical spread of our workforce and recognising that patients may have limited mobility the Authority require a number of service providers across Essex; the tender is therefore divided into 7 Lots. Bidders may apply for one or more Lots and the Authority may appoint more than one provider per Lot. Employees will be free to choose which provider they use and will not be compelled to use the provider closest to their home or work base locations. All questions and tender submissions are to be sent via Delta.
Additional Text: The initial contract period will be for a period of 2 years with the option to extend by 2 x 1 year periods, the total maximum contract duration is therefore 4 years if both extension options are taken, pricing is to be fixed for the initial term.

To deliver the services as outlined in the Job Description of Engagement Manager (Data and AI) as provided to the agency.

The Engagement Manager (Data and AI) is part of a new Data and AI Policy team set up to pursue our strategic objectives to ensure trustworthy use of patient data in research and to enable high-quality data-driven research and innovation. Title: WCC Tree Maintenance
Description:
Warwickshire County Council is seeking an external contractor to support an in-house team with maintenance of highway trees and those managed under SLAs within Warwickshire urban areas. The external contractor will be provided operations via an electronic database and be expected to complete the works in the timescales provided within the specification.

The Initial Term of the contract will be 2 years but the Council reserves the right to extend the contract by up to a maximum 24 month additional period. During the course of the contract period the range and scope of these services may be subject to modification and variation to meet the changing needs and requirements of the Council, potential changes in legislation and the changing demands placed on the Council by its customers. 

Warwickshire County Council will be using its e-tendering system (In-Tend) for the administration of this procurement process and providers must register with the system to be able to express an interest. The web address is: www.csw-jets.co.uk (https://www.csw-jets.co.uk) Registration and use of In-Tend is free. Once registered, all correspondence for this procurement process must be via the in-tend correspondence function. However, if you are unable to register with the website please email us at procurement@warwickshire.gov.uk

Title: IT Managed Service Contract
Description:
The Legal Services Board (LSB) is looking to appoint a suitably qualified provider of IT managed services. As a very small organisation, we do not have an in-house IT capability. We are looking for a supplier who can work in partnership with LSB to deliver the IT Managed Services to a high standard. Our aim is to appoint a supplier to provide an IT managed service to LSB commencing between 1 March 2022 and 31 May 2022 to allow parallel running with the existing supplier to facilitate an appropriate handover.
The Legal Services Board is the independent body responsible for overseeing the regulation of lawyers in England and Wales. In all our work, we seek to promote the eight regulatory objectives set out in the Legal Services Act 2007. We share our regulatory objectives with the 'approved regulators' of the legal profession, each of which have direct responsibility for the day-to-day regulation of the different types of lawyers.
As at 30 September 2021 we consist of 35 executive staff members (29 full-time and 6 part-time) and 9 non-executive directors that work part-time. We also provide IT licences and IT support to our Consumer Panel members (8 licences as at 30 September 2021) Our premises is currently located in central London with staff allowed to work flexibly anywhere geographically.
We work in an agile way and our approach is to enable our colleagues to work in any location at any time and LSB plans for this to continue in the future. We monitor changes in our operating environment, reviewing our objectives and, if necessary, adapting our approach. LSB users typically work between the hours of 7am and 7pm, Mondays to Fridays Some work takes place outside these hours and on weekends but on a limited scale.
There is a budget ceiling of Â£32,500 for the IT managed service per annum excluding VAT. This would exclude the cost of Microsoft office licences and cloud services which we would expect to be passed on at cost. Bids above this may still be considered with the score for Price adjusted to reflect this.
A tender is required which should include method statements, but not be limited to:
â¢ A description of how you would work with us.
â¢ A description of how you will meet the service specification requirements listed in the attached ITT.
â¢ A description of your recommended support package and what this 
includes and suggested SLAs (see Appendix Five)
â¢ A fully costed proposal including, but not limited to, remote support, hourly rates, discounts for block time agreements and costs for attending any site listed above. Where possible this should be broken down into annual costs including any set up fees.
â¢ Privacy policy documentation around accessing any corporate data held on our servers, PCs or mobile devices.
All tender submissions should be submitted by 12 noon on 15 November 2021 to tenders@legalservicesboard.org.uk. Submissions submitted to other addresses or beyond this time will not be accepted.
The full ITT is attached to this notice.

Title: Home Improvement and Adaptation payments under Disabled Facilities Grant
Description:
Currently as a Council we get Disabled Facilities Grant of approx. Â£6.1m per annum (expected for 2022-23). 
There are current arrangements where some RSLs do contribute and make payments to DCC.  DCC HIA carries out the works to all tenures and in the case of Believe Housing it has been paying for its own adaptations as part of the stock transfer agreement up to a specific level of spend (which has now been reached)

Believe Housing, as part of the stock transfer agreement has funded its own adaptations 100% since transfer but as from 1st April 2022 that responsibility will come back to DCC. 
The proposal is that Believe would make a contribution of 50% towards the adaptations costs as a goodwill gesture which means DCC would save 50% of the costs of works.  As part of the proposal Believe are requesting use of their own contractors to continue to deliver the adaptations to its stock with its own staff and contractors, in part for continuity of service, with DCC making the 50% contribution to them from our DFG allocation.

There is significant benefit to the Council in proceeding with a Single Supplier Negotiation with Believe Housing.  The council would save time and resources managing adaptations for Believe Housing tenants, and also that DCC expected circa Â£1m spend in the forward year, for Believe Housing adaptations, would be reduced to circa Â£500k.

[Believe Housing|Spectrum Business Park
Seaham, SR7 7TT|NONE||No|No]

Title: 374 Testing Opportunities for blending public and private finance
Description: This contract has been awarded to  work with 120 farmers and other stakeholders through a series of workshops and 1:1 discussions to produce opportunity maps to identify locations for habitat creation and restoration. They will identify the specific locations where biodiversity, carbon credits opportunities to improve water quality and reduce impacts of flooding should yield the optimal cost/ benefit balance.  These maps will then be used to extend and enhance their economic modelling tool (developed in their previous Test and Trial) by incorporating BNG, carbon payments, water quality improvements and NFM interventions to show the impact of these on the model farms at a macro level; and identify the potential impacts on farm incomes of available public and private income streams and to understand land manager responses to these opportunities

The Offshore Renewable Energy Catapult (OREC) Floating Offshore Wind Centre of Excellence (FOWCoE) is 
currently responsible for funding an online "guide to an offshore windfarm" (guidetoanoffshorewindfarm.com). 
This website helps companies and members of the public develop a greater understanding of the development 
of an offshore wind farm. It has been proposed that a new online guide is created specifically for 'floating'
offshore wind. This will educate people on the differences between floating and fixed wind farms and help 
avoid any confusion between the two.

Title: Selnet Partnership Opportunity: Provision of Employability Skills for Building Better Opportunities - Invest in Youth Project (Lancashire) Phase 3 (ESF/ NLCF Funded)
Description:
Selnet Ltd is the Social Enterprise Network for Lancashire and for over 15 years Selnet has supported social enterprises across Lancashire. In 2015/16 the organisation led a 12-month process to develop a Lancashire-wide partnership to provide specialist employability and skills support to young people aged 15-24 who are unemployed or economically inactive including those not in employment, education or training 'NEET' or at risk of becoming NEET. This project is known as Invest in Youth and is part of the Building Better Opportunities programme.

Building Better Opportunities (BBO) is a national programme funded by The National Lottery Community Fund (NLCF) and the European Social Fund (ESF) to invest in local projects tackling the root causes of poverty, promoting social inclusion and driving local jobs and growth.

The Invest in Youth project consists of approximately 11 diverse delivery partners from the voluntary, community, and social enterprise sectors, coming together to deliver specialist support for key groups across Lancashire. Selnet is the lead partner and does not undertake any delivery or direct support to participants. Invest in Youth has been operational since August 2016 and has recently received additional investment extending project delivery to the end of 2022.

Selnet is looking to select a suitably qualified and experienced organisation to provide employability skills support to Invest in Youth participants from within Lancashire. Preferred bidder status will be awarded to the organisation offering the most economically advantageous tender (in accordance with the evaluation criteria, scoring and weightings as set out in this document). The maximum budget available to the successful provider will be Â£75,000 and the successful provider must be able to meet the targets detailed above.

Proposals are sought from organisations that can demonstrate competence in engaging with and delivering relevant support to young people with multiple and complex barriers into employment, training or education.

Please register an interest in this opportunity on the Proactis supplier portal (link provided on this page) to access the full suite of tender documentation and to submit an application/proposal.

Title: Con_6692 Care Leaver Covenant Extension 22/23
Description: This is a compliant extension to a contract awarded in 2020. At its simplest the Care Leaver Covenant is a promise made by an organisation in the business, public or voluntary sectors to support care leavers aged 16 to 25. That promise is more than easy warm words of a well-meaning support but is a commitment backed up by a specific offer of something the organisation can realistically provide, and which will help care leavers live more independently. Those offers will relate to one or more of the five outcomes and could be in the form of paid apprenticeships or internships and other work-related opportunities, volunteering, mentoring, discounts, financial support and personal and life skills development. Just over 200 organisations have already made a commitment to the Care Leaver Covenant.

Title: Environmental Planning for Nuclear Decommissioning at Hartlepool, Heysham 1 and Dungeness B Power Station
Description:
The provision of professional services to prepare and submit planning applications, as well as other supporting assessments and documents, for the new waste management facilities at Heysham 1 Power Station. The scope of professional services also includes the preparation of an environmental statement for the decommissioning project under the  Environmental Impact Assessment for Decommissioning Regulations (EIADR). A summary of the key scope elements requirements of this Service is comprised of the following key elements set out below:

Planning: Planning permission is required from each relevant Local Planning Authority (LPA) under the TCPA to enable the construction and commission of each of the three waste management facilities. As part of this, planning advice on the scope of civil works, preparation of the planning application (including the planning statement and design and access statements), support during the application determination and post determination in discharging planning conditions will be required. 

Consultation and Engagement: Support is required in consultation and event management to support both TCPA and EIADR applications, including preparing consultation material, online and virtual engagement platforms, and data management in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation requirements. The preparation of Consultation Plans and Consultation Reports is also required. 

Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA): The potential environmental impacts of the decommissioning work has to be assessed through the EIA process, with appropriate Environmental Statements (ES) being submitted with each application for permission, as required by the TCPA EIA Regulations and the EIADR.

Marine Licence Applications: Some civil works associated with the waste management facilities and decommissioning works in the marine environment may also require a Marine Licence under the Marine and Coastal Access Act.

The Council will allocate an overall budget (inclusive of all costs and fees) of between Â£3-4m  annually for the programme, comprising circa 50-60 individual projects, which will be divided into two packages of work to be delivered by Area, i.e. 

1.	Westmorland and Furness (Barrow, Eden & South Lakeland) 
2.   	Cumberland (Allerdale, Carlisle & Copeland)
to reflect the two new authorities, which will be in place from April 2023.

Cumbria is currently undergoing a local government reorganisation and Government has announced that Cumbria County Council is to be replaced by two unitary authorities with effect form 01 April 2023.  Cumbria County Council shall be entitled to novate the Contract to any successor council as defined in The Local Government (Structural Changes) (Transfer of Functions, Property, Rights and Liabilities) Regulations 2008

Suppliers wishing to express an interest and obtain access to the tender documents should go to www.the-chest.org.uk and click on current opportunities from the navigation area on the left of the screen. On the next screen enter the contract Reference (DN596897) in the box labelled 'contains' then click search. Click on the Blue link for the contract title to view
the opportunity. To express an interest you will need to login. If you are not already registered on the www.the-chest.org.uk you will need to return to the home page and click on Register. Register FREE link in the navigation area on the left of the screen. Registration is free of charge and your username and password will be emailed to you.

Title: NEA - EcoSF3 - Lot 4 - LIFE WADER Harehope River Restoration
Description:
Develop a river restoration scheme at Harehope on the river Breamish in North Northumberland. Figure 1 below illustrates the ~ 3km stretch of river that has been straightened and canalised due to flood protection purposes. 
This project forms part of EU LIFE WADER. The project is being led by Natural England with the Environment Agency (EA), the Tweed Forum and Newcastle University as partners. The 5 key aims and actions of LIFE WADER are improved water quality, improved invasive control, reduced opportunistic macro algae, reduced disturbance and improved cross boarder working within the LIFE WADER project area. The EA will be leading on the improved water quality action with river restoration at Harehope playing a key role.

Title: CS21580 Research and Technology Organisations (RTO) Tender Transforming Foundation Industries (TFI)
Description:
The final date and time for the submission of bids is Monday 14th March 2022 at 14:00

DO NOT apply directly to the buyer.

All tender information MUST be submitted through the Delta eSourcing Portal.

Brief Description of Requirement

UKRI are seeking business engagement with small and medium sized Foundation Industries  businesses to guide them through the innovation landscape. We are specifically looking to target Foundation Industry companies who are new to grant funding. Applications can be from research and technology organisations (RTOs), research organisations (ROs) and consultants. The programme of support could be new and innovative, or based upon existing programmes and tailored to the needs of the Foundation Industries.  
UKRI are looking for a 9 month programme to provide Foundation Industries SMEs with a platform for innovation advice, by supporting businesses individually, or as a cohort approach to share learnings and develop a network

Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the Document Uploads tab within the Delta eSourcing Portal. 

This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria as set out in the ITQ  document. 

How to Apply

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Delta eSourcing Portal for this procurement. 

To register on the Delta eSourcing portal please use the link https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and follow the instructions to register.

If you are already registered on the Delta eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and the follow the instructions to 'Log in' 

Once you are logged into the system you will be able to link yourself into this procurement using the Access Code: 579T4T6TMX
Attachments: CS21580 AW5.2 Price Schedule - Final.xlsx UKRI Precedent Supplies Services Contract (Low value) - CS21580 - Final.pdf CS21580 - Delta - ITQ Invitation to Quote - Final.pdf CS21580 - Delta - ITQ Invitation to Quote questions - Final.pdf
Additional Text:
DO NOT APPLY DIRECTLY TO BUYER

All submissions will be assessed in accordance with the Public Procurement Regulations that apply to this opportunity.

Responses must be received by the date and time in the tender documentation; responses received outside of the deadline or not sent via the Delta eSourcing portal will not be accepted or considered by the Contracting Authority further for this opportunity. Interested organisations should ensure that they allow a sufficiency of time, prior to the deadline to allow all sections to be completed in full and any attachments to be uploaded.

As a user of the Delta eSourcing Portal you will have access to the Delta messaging service which facilitates all messages sent to you and from you, as well as other messages and updates in relation to any specific tender event. Please note that any and all information secured outside of the messaging service, shall have no merit or worth and should not be relied upon by any organisation submitting a tender response. 

Please note it is your organisations responsibility to access these messages on a regular basis to ensure you have sight of all relevant information applicable to this opportunity.

The Contracting Authority expressly reserves the right:

i.	not to award any contract as a result of the procurement process commenced by publication of this notice; and

ii.	to make whatever changes it may see fit to the content and structure of the procurement; and under no circumstances as part of your organisations participation in this opportunity, will the Contracting Authority be liable for any costs incurred by any organisation as a result. If the Contracting Authority decides to enter into a contract with any successful organisation(s), this does not mean that there is any guarantee of subsequent contracts being awarded. Any expenditure, work or effort undertaken prior to contract award is accordingly a matter solely for the commercial judgement of your organisation in doing so.

About UK Shared Business Services 

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) brings a commercial attitude to the public sector; helping our contracting authorities to improve efficiency, generate savings and modernise.

Where UK SBS is not named as the Contracting Authority within the documentation, UK SBS will be acting as an agent on behalf of the Contracting Authority.

Our broad range of expert services is shared by our customers. This allows our customers the freedom to focus resources on core activities; innovating and transforming their own organisations.

For full details of our partner base please review the following link: http://www.uksbs.co.uk/services/procure/contracts/Pages/default.aspx

Organisation Name: N E L COMMISSIONING SUPPORT UNIT
Title: Greenwich Bereavement Counselling Service
Description:
South East London CCG- Greenwich Borough is requesting expressions of interest for a Greenwich based bereavement counselling service for the residents of Greenwich Borough. The aim of the service is to provide good quality, cost effective bereavement support including counselling to residents of Greenwich.

The contract will be for an initial period of 3 years with an option to extend for a further 2 year period. The annual contract value is Â£52,500. The total contract value for the 5 year period is Â£262,500.

The client group will be residents who identify themselves, or who have been identified as in need of bereavement counselling including all sectors of the population, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disability, or housing status.

The Service will provide bereavement support including counselling to clients who have been bereaved including children. The service will provide a minimum of 400 bereavement support sessions in total per quarter, subject to demand, and train new Bereavement Volunteers' as appropriate to maintain a good quality service.The service should be flexible and accessible so as to be able to reach all people within the area in need of bereavement support.

Title: Staffordshire and Stoke on Trent GP Out of Hours Service
Description:
Staffordshire & Stoke on Trent CCGs sought  to commission a GP Out of Hours service which aligns with the requirements of the NHSE Integrated Urgent Care national service specification. This service  will come into  effect from the 1st April 2022 via a multiyear contract.
Commissioners tendered for services split into two (2) LOTs:-
LOT 1 - NHS North Staffordshire Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG)and Stoke on Trent CCG
LOT 2 - NHS Cannock Chase CCG, South East Staffordshire & Seisdon Peninsula CCG, East Staffordshire CCG and Stafford & Surrounds CCG
In addition to the core GP OOH service requirements LOT 2, covering the South CCG regions also incorporates an out of hours' provision for the Staffordshire prisons.
The contract is now awarded and let for a period of five (5) years with the option to extend up to two (2) years.
Contact Address 1: 120 Grove Road, Fenton , Stoke on Trent

Title: Insulation and Associated Works Framework
Description:
Efficiency East Midlands Ltd (EEM) is a not for profit consortium which establishes and manages a range of framework and DPS agreements. Our membership has now grown to 258 public sector organisations including housing associations and ALMO's, Local Authorities, NHS trusts, Education Providers, Blue Light Services, Government Agencies and Charities.
EEM have also established a formal collaboration with 3 like-minded procurement consortia - Westworks, South East Consortium and Advantage South West. The membership list for these three consortia may be obtained from the following website addresses:
www.westworks.org.uk (https://www.westworks.org.uk)
www.southeastconsortium.org.uk (https://www.southeastconsortium.org.uk)
www.advantagesouthwest.co.uk (https://www.advantagesouthwest.co.uk)

The framework has been tendered and awarded based on the following lot structure:
Sublot 1 - Midlands
Sublot 2 - East of England
Sublot 3 - National Coverage
Contracting Authorities can use either a Direct Selection or Mini Competition to appoint a Contractor and only the Contractors who sit on the relevant geographical sublots the Contracting Authority is looking to use can participate in the selection process.

EEM conducted this procurement exercise and have subsequently awarded and entered into framework agreements with contractors to carry out Insulation and associated works on behalf of our membership. Works via the framework are to include;
â¢ External Wall Insulation, design, enabling and installation works.
â¢ Exterior Render Systems .
â¢ Exterior Wall Cladding Systems.
â¢ External Wall Insulation Repair and Maintenance.
â¢ Internal Wall Insulation design, enabling and installation works.
â¢ Cavity Wall Insulation (Extraction Services, Virgin and Cavity Wall Insulation Re-fill).
â¢ Retrofit Floor Insulation (solid or suspended).
â¢ Loft Insulation (virgin and re-fill).
â¢ Attic/Room in Roof Insulation.
â¢ Retrofit Energy Efficiency measures to Park Homes.
â¢ Works associated with Insulation Programmes including but not limited to windows and doors, roofing, guttering, builders and ancillary works.

Full details of works covered by the framework are detailed within the tender documents.

Appointed framework contractors hold BBA accreditation and certification for insulation products. Installation of systems will be compliant with the manufacturer's instructions and latest PAS Standards.

Compliance with both PAS 2030: 2019 and PAS 2035: 2019 is mandatory for all companies installing insulation via an appropriate body such as British Board of AgrÃ©ment (BBA), The Insulation Assurance Authority (IAA) or equal approved body.

Contractors appointed to the framework are able to offer a Solid Wall Insulation Guarantee (SWIGA) or an equivalent work guarantee scheme guarantee for Solid Wall Insulation works and a Cavity Insulation Guarantee  (CIGA) or an equivalent work guarantee scheme for Cavity Wall Insulation works.
Additional Text:
The call-off contracts to be awarded pursuant to the framework agreements entered at conclusion of the procurement exercise may extend for a duration of up to 5 years beyond expiry of the 4-year framework term.

Please note that the total potential framework value stated within this notice and each lot is in relation to the full 4-year framework and takes into consideration the lot structure, length of call off contracts and that the EEM membership may grow over the framework lifetime .

This framework has been procured by Efficiency East Midlands Ltd (EEM Ltd) on behalf of their members and the other organisations described below as being authorised users. The following contracting authorities will be entitled to agree and award contracts under this framework agreement as authorised users:

Title: Contract 32 - Framework for Waste Collection and Disposal (SKIP HIRE) 2022-2023
Description:
North Tyneside Council (the 'Authority') is seeking tenders for the supply, collection and disposal of waste - skips. The Framework is for an initial period of 12 month period with an option to extend for up to a further 12 month period (potential 24 month contract) at the sole discretion of the Authority. The Contractor(s) will work with the Authority to provide innovative solutions to reduce costs and streamline delivery/collection methods throughout the contract term. This may include innovative products, ordering processes and invoicing.
Tenderers should review the basket of goods (Appendix 2) and ensure that they are able to supply the service.
All skips are to be fit for purpose and are to comply with all current relevant legislation and shall reflect industry good practice level specification and include waste collection and recycling / recovery / disposal service for non-hazardous wastes. The Contractor must provide skips for non-hazardous waste storage at designated sites identified by the Authority. These facilities are to be emptied on a required basis and maintained to the appropriate performance standards, with the requirement to react to emergency empties as required., the full Specification ( Scope of Works ) are included in the Tender pack which is available to download immediately after registering and interest in this opportunity via the NEPO Portal.  The link to the NEPO Portal is in additional information and unregistered suppliers will be re-directed to the registration page, registration and use of the NEPO Portal is free.
Additional Text:
The initial contract is for twenty four months with an option to extend for up to a further twelve months after which renewals will be undertaken in accordance with the Authority's contract Standing Orders
Accessing Tender documents 
Interested bidders must access the Tender documents for further information, which are available to download immediately in the NEPO Portal after registering an interest via the link below. unregistered suppliers will be re-directed to the free registration page.
The evaluation criteria is included in the Tender documents.

Title: Corporate Services for PLUSS CIC - Building Better Opportunities (BBO) Contracts
Description:
Pluss supports thousands of people with disabilities and other disadvantages to move into employment each year.

With a turnover of over Â£17 million and a proven track record spanning more than 45 years, we are recognised as one of the leading national disability employment specialists in the UK.

We deliver a range of nationally and locally procured employment programmes on behalf of the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP), European Social Fund (ESF), National Lottery Community Fund, Local Authorities and the NHS (the Funders). We are rated as 'good' by the Merlin Standard for quality and treatment of our subcontractors.

Our employment operations help jobseekers who need the most specialist support to find work and achieve a career. Our enterprise operations support to create direct employment opportunities in a wide range of businesses and job roles.

As the largest Social Firm in the UK, we directly employ 470 people around half of whom have a disability or long-term health condition.

The Pluss Organisation C.I.C (Pluss) is seeking to establish an Agreement for Corporate Services to support the organisation in the delivery of its Positive People and Hopeful Families contracts which are projects funded by the European Social Fund and the National Lottery Community Fund.

These are led and managed by Pluss, a Community Interest Company. These programmes offer a lifeline to people who are not in work to help build confidence, skills and give a sense of hope for the future. We empower people to get involved in local communities, connect with others and feel good through a range of social prescribing and employability activities. Positive People is delivered by a partnership of social enterprises and community organisations, the support offered to participants will vary, with services ranging from support for drugs and alcohol misuse right through to arranging workplace adjustments for sensory disabilities.

We are seeking to award a contract to a supplier/s that meets all the requirements. The scope of requirements covers the supply of ALL Corporate Services, which shall be split into the following areas: Commercial & Contract Management, Risk/ Business Continuity, Helpdesk, Finance, DSC Support, Estates, Quality and Compliance, IT and HR.

Please see the attached RFI for further specification, including how to respond to this request.
Attachments: RFI Pluss CIC - Corp Services - 2nd Issueing_FINAL v3_March2022.doc
Additional Text: Follow the instructions given in the description or the more information section

Title: Moneywise Plus (ESF/BBO funded project) delivery partner procurement
Description:
Moneywise Plus, helps to boost the work and life opportunities of unemployed and disadvantaged people across Leicester and Leicestershire. Led by Reaching People, funded by the European Social Fund and The National Lottery Community Fund, the project is delivered through partner organisations, providing 1-2-1 adviser support to help people to overcome barriers to employment; build key financial and digital life skills and move people closer to their goals.   We are looking for a delivery organisation to join the partnership.

The maximum contract value is Â£70,000. The budget is based on 2 FTE staff (24 months of adviser delivery) and includes 15% for management and office costs, as per the funder's restrictions. 

The required outputs are to contribute to overall project targets and, as a minimum, as follows: 
â¢	60 new participants  signed up to the project by Dec 2022.
â¢	12 participants exited into education/training and 12 participants into job search on completion of the support.
â¢	3  'soft outcomes' achieved by 60 clients showing improved financial, digital and social confidence. 

Applications will be shortlisted against the following selection criteria.  Organisations must:
â¢	Have experience and expertise in providing effective, holistic, client focussed, 1-2-1 support and advice a) on a range of issues such as benefits, housing, money matters etc. b) to build financial, digital and employability skills and confidence. 
â¢	Have a track record of delivering successfully against targets, in target driven projects and ideally, ESF funded. 
â¢	Be well established and effectively networked within Leicester and/or Leicestershire to reach the project client group and referral organisations. 
â¢	Be able to meet the robust financial and administrative, quality and audit requirements of the project at both organisation and adviser level.
â¢	Bring added value to the Moneywise Plus project and partnership.
â¢	Have the necessary organisational capacity, viability and financial standing to deliver.

Applications must include:
a)	A summary (no more than 1500 words), of how you meet the above criteria.
b)	A completed 'organisation information and compliance form'. The information will form part of our shortlisting process. 

Applications should be sent to Sangeeta Patel, Project Manager, by email to sangeeta@reachingpeople.co.uk or by post to 15 Wellington Street, Leicester, LE1 6HH by 14 March 2022 at 5.00pm. Shortlisted organisations will be invited to present their application. 

Deadline for clarifications is 7 March 2022 at 5.00pm and will be posted on the Reaching People website. 

The details of the soft outcomes; organisational information and compliance form; clarifications and updates can be found at https://www.reachingpeople.co.uk/moneywise-plus-bbo-project-partner-procurement-financial-and-digital-inclusion-and-employability-support-7-3/

Title: PROVISION OF MEDICAL OFFICER APPRAISER TRAINING
Description:
The Authority has a requirement to continue to develop and sustain a cohort of medical appraisers of medical practitioners.  To meet professional body regulations, they are to be trained to equivalent standards of NHS England. 

The requirement is for up to two medical appraiser training courses to train up to 40 appraisers per year.  Trainees may include a combination of new medical appraisers and current medical appraisers who wish to refresh their appraiser training.

Each course must be able accommodate a minimum of 15 trainees and up to a maximum of 25 trainees in a face to face classroom environment.  

At the agreement of both the Authority and the Contractor a virtual course may replace a face to face course.

It is anticipated courses will take place in April and September.  Locations will be discussed with the Contractor prior to formalising course dates.  All venues will be provided by the MOD at no cost to the Contractor. Title: PROVISION OF SCHOOL HEALTH NURSING AND CHILD VISION SCREENING SERVICES  - AWARD
Description:
The Provision of School Health Nursing and Child Vision Screening Services;
      
      Our vision for Sandwell 2030 is that it will be a place that is thriving, optimistic and has a resilient community. The Sandwell School Health Nursing Programme and the Sandwell Paediatric Vision Screening Service will make an important contribution towards; 
      
      o Aspiration 2; Sandwell is a place where we live healthy lives and live them for longer, and where those of us who are vulnerable feel respected and cared for.
      
      o Aspiration 4; Our children benefit from the best start in life and a high-quality education throughout their school careers with outstanding support from their teachers and families.
      
      The best possible health underpins a child's or young person's ability to fulfil their potential as they grow up. Research shows that good health and emotional wellbeing are associated with improved attendance and attainment at school, which in turn lead to improved employment opportunities. In addition, children who thrive at school are better placed to act on information about how to maintain a healthy lifestyle.
      
      In 2009, the Department for Health set out an evidence-based programme of best practice; the Healthy Child Programme, with the ambition of making everywhere as good as the best by developing improvements in health and wellbeing for children and young people. The Healthy Child Programme has recently been modernised to reflect societal changes and the impact of COVID-19 (Public Health England, 2021) and the provision of universal vision screening is identified within the Healthy Child Programme as crucial to enabling early diagnosis and treatment of vision problems.
      
      The Council intends to enter into ONE Contract for both Lot 1 and Lot 2 with a Single Preferred Provider
      
      The Tender  Document(s) will be made available to suppliers who Express Interest on the Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council Tendering Portal. To access the portal please click the following link https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc
      
      You will be required to log into an existing account or register a new one. Once logged in, from the top menu bar click on 'Tenders' to list all the current opportunities. Once you have found the relevant opportunity you should click on 'View Details' in order to Express Interest.
      
      Closing date for submission of tender is 10 September 2021, 13:00 Hours

Title: Provision of Connected Autonomous Plant (CAP) Maturity Levels
Description: This PAS to develop a taxonomy, definitions and performance requirements for the various CAP Capability/Maturity levels in a way that it is easy to communicate and may be used for procurement. These technical and operational capability levels will range from what might be considered 'low levels' of CAP capability or readiness through to the higher levels of CAP covering the expected connectivity, levels of automation, coordination and operational safety and performance considerations. In defining the various CAP levels therefore, the standard would set out the anticipated performance within the given CAP levels. A standard would help create a common reference for CAP and allow CAP operation to be described consistently, including use in procurement. The standard could be socialized both as good practice and as the basis of future further standardization in this area.

Title: CP2025-20 Domestic Abuse Awareness and Response Training Package
Description:
Devon County Council (DCC) is seeking to contract with a Bidder that can develop the content for a tiered Domestic Abuse Awareness and Response Training Package that is delivered as an e-learning package via the Devon Learning Pool (DeL) portal. 

DeL allows staff members to access and complete mandatory or optional training when required. User access is via an email and password with a record of learning retained for proof and further development if required. The system allows for course to be completed in one go or over a period of time dependent upon the duration of course and/or learner.

The requirements of this procurement comprise of five stages: 

a)	Development of the Domestic Abuse specific course content across Level 1,2 and 3 of training Package 
b)	Work with Devon County Council to development of an interactive e-learning package for Level 1, 2 and 3
c)	Design and facilitation of the Level 3 Virtual Practice Session (in a 1 2 Many situation)
d)	Development of the Competency and Assessment Suite 
e)	On-going up-date and maintenance of course content (if required)

Title: RFP for the provision of a 5G Popup/Cell-on Wheels (CoW)
Description:
A 5G Popup/Cell-on Wheels (CoW) - comprising of at least
1. A trailer (with external power feed, inbuilt power generator, refrigerated cabinet for kit, etc) (can be towed using another vehicle).
2. Telescopic/retractable mast (up to 12m)
3. 3 X directional antenna and 1 omni directional for the shared spectrum range of 3.8 to 4.2 GHz (e.g. similar to AW3828, AW3825) - with ability to selectively turn on/off different antenna
4. Suitable BBUs, RRUs (subject to 3.) to drive the antenna - delivering a strong signal within a 1 Km radius range
5. 5G Core Network hosted on suitable COTS HW (HP/Dell) on the trailer
6. MEC platform/UPF on separate platform (HP/Dell) on the trailer
7. High throughput satellite backhaul (either use of adjustable or auto-pointing antenna) this is for access to internet/DN or remote 5G Core
8. Cabinet with sufficient space to be able to add additional equipment in future
9. Extendable architecture of the setup to allow for different hardware to be added as needed
All assembled and delivered to SA Catapult Westcott campus.

Title: Operational Fire Fighting Facilities
Description:
Following the publication of VEAT Notice 2022/S 000-007036, BMKFA awarded a contract for the provision of appropriate specialist venues, equipment and facilities, in collaboration with Buckinghamshire Fire and Rescue Service Instructors, to deliver firefighting training including Fire behaviour, tactical ventilation simulation, highway scenarios, Breathing Apparatus assessments, Incident Command assessment exercises, Multi-Agency scenarios, Open Programme Instructor development courses and Incident Command refresher courses in accordance with National Operational Guidance and standards.  Accommodation and catering requirements will be included at the venue for BMKFA delegates and Instructors. 
As part of the contract package, Buckinghamshire Fire & Rescue Service will provide Instructors to the Fire Service College to utilise for up to 300 days a year to support the delivery and development of the Fire Service College courses. Each day will generate a training credit to be offset against the delivery costs of the contracting Authority's fire service annual training requirements.  The Fire Service College will provide accommodation, provided for the night prior to any delivery, and catering provided on a full board basis to the Authority's Instructors.
The level of facilities, equipment and venue must be appropriate to deliver the required scenarios to meet the current National Operational Guidance and standards, at one location and able to accommodate the opportunities for the further development of the Authority's Instructors whilst providing a flexible cost-effective collaborative solution.
The contract will commence 01 June 2022 for a term of 3 years, with an option to extend a further 24 months at the discretion of the Contracting Authority/Provider.

Description:
Title: UID10683 Trafford, Stockport and Tameside Chlamydia and Gonorrhoea Screening Support Service.

The Chest Portal reference is DN578563.

This procurement is lead by Trafford Council on behalf of Trafford, Stockport and Tameside Councils.

Brief Description: Provision of an online service for chlamydia and gonorrhoea testing primarily for young women under 25, but also for young men where capacity allows.  The service would provide kits online and also through local distribution sites. It includes laboratory testing, results management, partner notification and testing, treatment and referral into treatment. 
Please see Request For Quotation (RFQ) documentation for details.

Contract Period: 1st April 2022 - 31st March 2027.

Title: Safe Regeneration Framework acting by its agent Rise Construction Framework Ltd
Description: Rise Construction Framework (Rise) is the agent for SAFE Regeneration Ltd ("SAFE"); it is intended that SAFE will be a Central Purchasing Body (as defined by Regulation 2(1) of the UK statutory Instrument 2015 No.102 "The Public Contract Regulations 2015" as amended by the Public Procurement (Amendment etc) (EU Exit) Regulations 2020 (SI 2020/1319).About Rise: Rise was born out of a strong conviction that a construction framework could deliver exceptional service to the framework users while positively impacting the communities within its operating areas. Quite simply, commerciality and social value could co-exist and create an innovative and purposeful new model. We are the UK's only pro-social body providing agency services to construction frameworks with a proven track record of supporting deprived communities by investing our profits into community prevention and intervention initiatives. Pro-social businesses are self-sustainable social organisations that exist to provide social benefits to the communities around them.The framework has been designed taking into consideration the construction playbook to ensure the framework is fit for purpose for its  public-sector users. Users  of SAFE's current framework, which will shortly come to term, include NHS Foundation Trusts https://www.england.nhs.uk/publication/nhs-provider-directory/#l, Clinical Commissioning Groups, Educational Institutions, Providers of Social Housing, Local Authorities, Charities and 3rd Sector Groups and Community Led Housing Organisations across the North West of England and North Wales.Public-sector bodies able to access the framework will include: Local Authorities, Universities, Schools, Academies, Colleges, Social Housing Providers, Community Land Trusts or other Community Led Housing Organisations, Emergency Services, Health & Social Care providers, NHS bodies, Clinical Commissioning groups, Government Departments, Museum and Arts, Charities & 3rd Sector Organisations and Public Body subsidiary companies.The framework will operate across North West of England (Merseyside, Cheshire, Lancashire, Cumbria, Greater Manchester), North Wales (Isle of Anglesey, Conway, Denbighshire, Flintshire, Gwynedd, Wrexham), Yorkshire and the Humber (East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire, South Yorkshire, West Yorkshire, North Lincolnshire, North East Lincolnshire).The framework will consist of 17 Groups with each group having varying values of work/services (value bands). Each group/value band will be allocated a maximum number of supply partners who score the highest during the competition; the supply partner allocation table can located via this link: https://rise-framework.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/Rise-Framework-Lot-Allocation-Numbers.pdfContract award will be on a lot-by-lot basis with the option of direct appointment for contracts whose contract value will fall below the threshold current at the time of the formation of the contract or further mini-competition. Due to the complexity of the framework the Terms and Conditions (T&Cs) will not be set out in the framework agreement but will be issued on a project-by-project basis with bespoke service agreements for professional services.

Further information about the Venue can be found at http://www.manchestercentral.co.uk/
If you are interested in the opportunity, please email the procurement inbox at procurement@manchestercentral.co.uk 
The last date to request documentation for the Contract will be 4pm on 14th March 2022.
Once an expression of interest has been received you will be emailed the Invitation to Tender (ITT) which can be automatically accessed. 
The closing date for receipt of completed documentation will be 15th March 2022 at noon.
It is anticipated for the contract to be awarded by 21st March 2022 with a targeted start date of 15th April 2022
Completed ITT documents must be emailed to procurement@manchestercentral.co.uk no later than this date. The tender code must be stated in the email subject
Manchester Central is currently looking for a Contractor to provide Wi-Fi Portal Services at Manchester Central. The Contract will be for a period of two (2) years with a Manchester Central option to extend for an additional one (1) year. It is intended for the contract to commence on 15 April 2022.  Contract value estimated at Â£40k

The following items are required:

â¢	A single SSID with portal page to allow access to free and premium services. The portal page must be configurable with pre-defined templates to allow clients to apply their brand and show sponsor adverts.
â¢	A minimum of four customisable portal pages with the option to show in different areas of the venue.
â¢	The portal page must have the option to turn on/off data capture along with the option to ask a question.
â¢	A family friendly Wi-Fi service needs to be enabled on the free WIFI with the option to turn it off when required.
â¢	Location analytics to show the movement of visitors (devices) over a period of time.
â¢	Ability to change the speed of premium and free services when required

Title: Sanctions Research Support
Description:
As part of the international response to the Russian invasion of Ukraine in February 2022, a large number of sanctions have been introduced against people, entities and ships pursuant to new powers contained in the Economic Crime Bill.

A number of sanctions have been introduced in the UK to mirror their introduction abroad by the UK's allies. Under the Regulations, the UK then has 56 days to produce a Sanctions Designation Form (SDF) in support of the introduction of these sanctions. Due to the unprecedented scale of sanctions introduced in response to the Ukraine crisis and the short timescale for the production of SDFs, external support is needed to conduct open-source research and produce evidence packs to ensure that the 56-day deadline can be met.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Kings College London|22 Kingsway, London WC2B 5RL|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Title: Incident Management Software
Description:
The contract requires contractors to deliver a software fit for purpose within the Waltham Forest Control Centre and Incident Management team. The purpose is to ensure the efficient management of incidents within the Borough. This is critical to inhouse delivery of major and critical incidents. The software needs to:

â¢	Improve Incident Response Times
To provide the Borough with an efficient way of handling major incidents that will rationalise the process and give staff more time to concentrate on the event that is occurring.
â¢	Target individuals, groups, or use dynamic rules to reach the right people
To communicate the incidents and the threat of incidents to the right people in a timely manner.
â¢	Easy to use
To automate event communications, giving the relevant information to the right people when required.
â¢	Ability to receive information via an App/Email/SMS/Mobile and Landline, also capable of posting to social media sites
Enable the staff to map events in locations within the Borough
Allow the viewing of mapped assets in relationship to threats/events.
â¢	Audit trail
Record the responses to incident notifications and therefore track when responses were received
â¢	Document Management
Enable all Business Continuity plans to be stored in the system, thereby allowing staff access to the information they need without contacting the Crisis Management team.

The purpose of this exercise is to put a framework in place for the provision of Building Cleaning Services that can be used by further education colleges / Institutions, universities, sixth forms, academies, schools, museums and other similar organisations. Local Authorities may also wish to use the resulting framework when procuring on behalf of Educational Establishments.  User details are available from the following link www.thecpc.ac.uk/Users/regions.php. Future members of the CPC will be from the education sector: - www.gov.uk/guidance/get-information-about-schools
The tender is available for Higher Education institutions through NWUPC  http://www.nwupc.ac.uk/our-members
The tender is available for UK public sector bodies www.thecpc.ac.uk/suppliers/eligible-public-sector-bodies. 




To access this competition: 

Registered:
Login to https://suppliers.multiquote.com and view the opportunity CA8995.

Not registered:
Visit https://suppliers.multiquote.com then register and quote CA8995 as the reason for registration. 

 Any queries please contact MultiQuote on 0151 482 9230.
